intro: Hieracium greenei, commonly known as Greene's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium greenei is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
